criteria.name: Completeness
criteria.description: Covers full D3 workflow from setup to advanced layouts

levels.5: Complete coverage: selections, data joins, scales, shapes, layouts, transitions, interactions with examples
levels.3: Core concepts covered but missing advanced topics (force layouts, geographic maps) or practical examples
levels.1: Incomplete: missing critical concepts like scales or data joins

criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: Explanations are clear with WHY sections and code examples

levels.5: Every concept has WHY explanation, clear examples, and common pitfalls documented
levels.3: Most concepts explained but some lack context or examples
levels.1: Unclear explanations, missing examples, jargon without definitions

criteria.name: Actionability
criteria.description: Provides copy-paste templates and step-by-step workflows

levels.5: Complete code templates for all common charts, step-by-step workflows with checklists
levels.3: Some templates and workflows but incomplete or missing key patterns
levels.1: Theoretical only, no actionable code or workflows

criteria.name: Structure
criteria.description: Organized with clear navigation and progressive learning path

levels.5: Interactive hub, clear workflows, logical resource organization, all content linked
levels.3: Organized but navigation unclear or some content orphaned
levels.1: Disorganized, hard to navigate, no clear entry points

criteria.name: Triggers
criteria.description: YAML description clearly defines WHEN to use skill

levels.5: Trigger-focused description with specific use cases, anti-triggers documented
levels.3: Some triggers mentioned but vague or missing anti-triggers
levels.1: Generic description, unclear when to use

criteria.name: Resource Quality
criteria.description: Resources are self-contained, under 500 lines, with WHY/WHAT structure

levels.5: All resources <500 lines, WHY sections present, no orphaned content
levels.3: Some resources over limit or missing WHY sections

criteria.name: User Collaboration
criteria.description: Skill creation involved user at decision points

levels.5: User approved at each major step, validated structure and scope
levels.3: Some user input but limited collaboration
